title: How to rotate an image in HTML - Quora

response.answer_text: Another answer suggested the image-orientation CSS property, which is only supported in Firefox. A more inclusive method would be the CSS transform property with a rotate method applied: img { transform: rotate(90deg); } You can use a negative number to go the other way. If you need to support IE 9 and/or older versions of  iOS Safari and the Android browser, include the browser prefixes: img { -ms-transform: rotate(90deg); -webkit-transform: rotate(90deg);  transform: rotate(90deg); } Also you could use the scale method to flip, or flop and image. Scaling an image negatively on the x axis will fl0p it (make a mirror-image), scaling on the y axis will flip it upside-down. /* flop, or mirror image */  transform: scale(-1, 1);  /* flip upside-down */  transform: scale(1, -1);

With HTML alone? You can't. With HTML+CSS, however... Paul Mccann's answer is the right answer because transform is supported on most platforms: Can I use...
